Posts.Content: Mar 16, 2011 09:56PM - edited Mar 16, 2011 09:59PM by BCWarrior It sounds like some of you are referring to the hand/foot syndrome. 200 mg daily of vitamin B6 works wonders for me. The problem started when I was on Xeloda (now on Doxil) and my hands were beginning to look like hamburger meat. A friend told me about the B6 and I was amazed. Now I've developed a rash on both arms that looks like psoriasis, particularly on the elbows. After some online research I decided to try pure, unrefined shea butter along with black soap. I just ordered both online from nasabb.com. Hope it works. I see my onc next week and I suspect he will tell me to take a couple decadron pills.
